revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = VueScan | developer = Hamrick Software (Ed Hamrick; David Hamrick) | screenshot = [[File:VueScan 9.0 (32-bit) screenshot.jpg|300px]] | released = {{start date and age|1998|df=yes}} | discontinued = | latest release version = 9.0.63 | latest release date = {{start date and age|2011|11|17|df=yes}} | operating system = [[Windows 9x]]
[[Windows NT 4]] or later
[[Mac OS X Panther]] or later
[[Ubuntu 8.10]] or later
[[Red Hat Linux]] 9 or later | platform = [[IA-32]] and [[x64]] | size = '''Windows:''' 6 [[Megabyte|MB]]
'''Mac OS:''' 9 MB
'''Linux:''' 6 MB | language = | status = | genre = [[Image scanner]] and [[optical character recognition]] | license = [[Shareware]] | website = {{URL|www.hamrick.com/}} }} '''VueScan''' is an [[image scanning]] and [[optical character recognition]] computer program developed by Ed Hamrick since 1998.{{Cite web |url = http://download.cnet.com/VueScan/3640-2085_4-10068488.html |title = VueScan |work = [[Download.com]] |publisher = CBS Interactive |date = 25 May 2011 |accessdate = 26 May 2011 }}{{Cite web |url = http://www.scantips.com/vuescan.html |title = VueScan |work = A few scanning tips |first = Wayne |last = Fulton |accessdate = 26 May 2011 }} It enables the user to tweak and fine-tune the scanning parameters. The program uses its own independent method to interface with scanner hardware. Therefore it is able to use an old scanner without a device driver on new x64 systems.{{Cite news |url = http://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,1631621,00.asp |title = VueScan 8.0 Professional |work = [[PC Magazine]] |publisher = Ziff Davis |date = 27 July 2004 |first = David |last = Stone |accessdate = 26 May 2011 }} The VueScan website lists more than 1,500 different supported scanners and digital cameras on Windows, 1,100 on Mac OS X and 700 on Linux.{{Cite web |url = http://www.hamrick.com/vuescan/vuescan.htm#supported |title = Supported Scanners |work = Release Notes |publisher = Hamrick Software |year = 2011 |accessdate = 26 May 2011 }} VueScan is sold as one downloadable file with two different licenses (Standard and Professional). The license code determines which version is running. Without license the program runs in demo mode. The demo mode is identical to the professional license except that dollar-sign watermarks are superimposed on both saved and printed images. By default VueScan only supports performing optical character recognition of English documents. However, 32 additional language packages are available for download from its website.{{cite web|title=Adding OCR Languages|url=http://www.hamrick.com/ocr.html|work=VueScan|publisher=Hamrick Software|accessdate=26 May 2011}} As of September 2011 Ed Hamrick was "selling $3M per year of VueScan licenses".{{cite web|url = http://www.snowhenge.net/pblog/article/Why_is_Vuescan_struggling|title = Why is Vuescan struggling ?|accessdate = 2011-11-20}} ==See also== * [[SilverFast]] – alternative scanner software * [[Image Capture]] – alternative scanner software bundled free with Mac OS X * [[Scanner Access Now Easy]] – open source scanner API for Unix, Windows, OS/2 ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{Cite web |url = http://vuescan.softpedia.com |title = Softpedia Global Page for VueScan Downloads |work = [[Softpedia]] |publisher = SoftNews NET SRL |date = 26 May 2011 |accessdate = 26 May 2011 }} }} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.hamrick.com/}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vuescan}} [[Category:Graphics software]] [[Category:Windows software]] [[Category:Mac OS X software]] [[Category:Shareware]] [[Category:Optical character recognition]] {{Windows-software-stub}} {{Mac-software-stub}} {{Linux-stub}} {{Graphics-software-stub}} [[de:VueScan]]
